main_definition: A particular form or variation of something, often used to refer to an edition or release of a product, such as software, literature, or other creative works.

meanings_and_examples.example: His version of reality was different from mine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particular form or variation of a product, such as software or media content
meanings_and_examples.example: The latest version of the software includes several new features.

meanings_and_examples.definition: One of multiple iterations in development, often used in relation to documents or plans
meanings_and_examples.example: They reviewed three different versions of the project proposal before finalizing it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particular edition or release number, typically used for products like video games
meanings_and_examples.example: The Xbox 360 has multiple versions including Xbox 360 S and Kinect-enabled models.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An alternative interpretation or understanding of a concept or idea
meanings_and_examples.example: In philosophy, there are many different versions of the meaning of happiness.
